intro: Reseda mira, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny areas and has small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to blue. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils. Reseda mira is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
